title: Wedding 12-Month Timeline
description: Comprehensive wedding planning timeline from 12 months to 2 weeks before

tasks.title: Envision your wedding: style, venue, traditions
Hire an event planner
Set a wedding date
Work out global budget including VAT
Decide guest numbers
Look at venues
First meeting with JustSeventy
Compile guest list and addresses
Decide and book your venue
Send save-the-dates (prioritise travel guests)
Start dress research
Create time plan (start and finish times)
Choose wedding party
Register for gifts
Decide on wedding attire theme
Book photographer and videographer
Research and book band/DJ
Order wedding dress
Book florist
Book ceremony musicians
Finalize menu and cake design
Book hair and makeup artists
Arrange accommodation for guests
Create wedding website
Order invitations and stationery
Plan honeymoon
Shop for rings
Book transportation
Finalize ceremony details with officiant
Schedule dress fittings
Mail invitations
Apply for marriage license
Finalize readings and vows
Plan rehearsal dinner
Order wedding party attire
Create seating chart
Final venue walk-through
Confirm all vendor bookings
Purchase accessories and shoes
Finalize song list with band/DJ
Write toasts and speeches
Schedule final dress fitting
Send timeline to all vendors
Finalize seating chart and place cards
Confirm final headcount with caterer
Break in wedding shoes
Prepare payment envelopes for vendors
Rehearsal with wedding party
Confirm all vendor arrival times
Final dress fitting and pickup
Pack for honeymoon
Prepare emergency kit
Get manicure and hair trial
Delegate day-of tasks to wedding party

title: Bar Mitzvah 12-Month Timeline
description: Complete Bar Mitzvah planning timeline from 12 months to 2 weeks before

tasks.title: Start to plan what you want your event to look like, look online, on Pinterest
Decide if you want a theme, if not a colour scheme
Hire an event planner
Set a Bar Mitzvah date (check with important guests before finalising)
Everyone else of Synagogue, if needing
Work out your global approximate budget including VAT
Decide on number of guests
Look at venues
Have your first meeting with JustSeventy
Compile guest list and guest expresses using the JustSeventy template
Decide and book venue
Send out save the date cards, priority to out of town guests
Time plan is made to decide start and finish time of your event
Take out event insurance
Source caterer
Source florist
Source photographer
Research music, e.g. DJ, musicians, band
Book band/DJ
Research and book accommodation for yourself/guests, if necessary
Start deciding on entertainment that you want at the Bar Mitzvah weekend
Look into different styles of stationery and start designs
Order invitations, including Friday night, Shabbat lunch, Sunday lunch (if desired)
Review florist proposals and start mood boarding
Decide on table name style, for example, table numbers, etc.
Book entertainment e.g. photo booth, graffiti artists etc.
Review catering proposals and select vendor
Approve print proofs and order stationery 'Save the date etc'
Finalise entertainment acts
Select and order cake, if required
Food tasting with caterer to finalise menu
Ensure all your invites are sent out and guests where required
Make a list of people giving toasts or speeches. 'Are there any religious requirements'
Discuss items such as cake topper, glassware, table plans, table cards, menu printed sample
Do you wish to provide transport for your guest? e.g. cars, coaches etc.
Collate guest RSVPs and dietary requirements
Assign seating for guests 'Ask your planner for recommended template'
Order novelties
Finalise your time plan
Give photographer/videographer a list of specific shots
Order gifts for the Mitzvah guests that are doing speeches
Ensure all events have been RSVPS e.g.
Re-confirm final details with all suppliers
Re-confirmed final details (incl. all suppliers)
Send the final guest list and dietary requirements to the caterer, or JS do this where they will see the seating plan
Ensure payment has been made to all suppliers requiring a Letter of Anganement

title: Bat Mitzvah 12-Month Timeline

tasks.title: Start to plan what you want your event to look like, on a timeline
Hire an event planner if not a colour scheme
Set a Bat Mitzvah date (book with synagogue guest before Rosh)
Work out your global approximate budget including VAT
Decide on number of guests
Look at venues
Have your first meeting with JustSeventy
Compile guest list and guest addresses using the client/JustSeventy template
Decide and book venue
Send out save the dates cards, priority to out of town guests
Time plan is made to decide start and finish time of your event
Take out event insurance
Source caterer
Source florist
Source photographer
Source videographer
Research music e.g. DJ, musician/singer
Book band/DJ
Research and book accomodation for yourself/party, if necessary
Research and book accomodation for out of town guests at the Bat Mitzvah weekend
Look into different styles of stationery and start designs
Order invitations, including Friday night, Shabbat lunch, Sunday lunch (if desired)
Review Menu proposals and start tasting
Decide on table name style, for example, table numbers, etc.
Book entertainment e.g. photo booth, graffiti artists etc.
Review catering proposals and select vendor
Approve print proofs and order stationery 'Save the date etc'
Finalise entertainment acts
Select and order cake, if required
Food tasting session to finalise menu
Ensure all your invites are sent out and guests where necessary
Make a list of possible giving toasts or speeches 'Are there any religious requirements'
Organise/book transportation for key guests where necessary
Order novelties
Discuss items such as cake topper, glassware table plans, table cards, glassware etc.
Do your walk through/rehearsal for your event, e.g. cake, centrepiece etc.
Collate guest RSVPs and dietary requirements
Assign seating for guests, 'Ask your planner for recommended template'
Have timings ready
Order novelties
Discuss items brief
Write the order of the service, You will also upload a version of charts, tables, glassware etc.
Ensure all events have been on confirm e.g. and Kiddush if over Letter of Engagement
Re-confirm final details with chef (e.g., RSVPS)
Share event details/timings
Send the final guest list and dietary requirements to the caterer, or JS do this where, they will see the seating plan
Ensure purchase has been made for all those supplier requiring a Letter of Authorization
Give photographer/videographer a list of specific shots
Order gifts for these attending your event

title: Party 12-Month Timeline
description: Comprehensive party planning timeline from 12 months to 2 weeks before

tasks.title: Start to plan what you want your event to look like, look online, on Pinterest, ahead of lots of your favorite parties
Decide if you want a theme, if not a colour scheme
Hire an event planner
Set a date (check with important guests before finalising)
Work out your global approximate budget including VAT
Decide on number of guests
Look at a few venues
Have your first meeting with JustSeventy
Compile guest list and organise addresses using the JustSeventy template
Decide and book the venue
Send out save the date cards, priority to out of town guests
Time plan is made to decide start and finish time of your event
Take out event insurance
Source caterer
Source florist
Source photographer
Source videographer
Source music e.g. DJ, musicians, band
Decide and book your entertainment
Research and book accommodation for yourself/guests, if necessary
Start deciding on entertainment that you want at the party
Look into different styles of stationery and start designs
Order invitations
Book decor for reception/styling such as chairs, tables, linen etc.
Book entertainment e.g. photo booth, graffiti artists etc.
Cut the catering deal
Approve print proofs and order stationery 'Save the date etc'
Finalise entertainment acts
Select and order cake, if required
Food tasting with caterer to finalise menu
Ensure all your invites are sent out and guests where required
Make a list of people giving toasts or speeches. 'Are there any religious requirements'
Plan/Centerpiece sample meeting. 'We will also present samples of chairs, plants, glassware etc.'
Do you wish to provide transport for your guest? e.g. cars, coaches etc.
Collate guest RSVPs and dietary requirements
Assign seating for guests 'Ask your planner for recommended template/programme'
Discuss music brief
Finalise your time plan
Give photographer/videographer a list of specific shots
Ensure all guests have RSVP'd
Key remaining event details outlined in your Letter of Engagement
Re-confirm final details with all suppliers
Finalise seating plan
Send the final guest list and dietary requirements to the caterer and the venue. 'Most will require final numbers 2 weeks before'
